```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(BMA)

```

## Continous case



```{r cont}
train=read.csv('../data/train/datacontinuousstudents_train.csv')

y=train%>%
  dplyr::select(y)%>%
  as.matrix()
x=train%>%
  select(-y,-id)%>%
  as.matrix()

obj=bic.glm(x[,1:16],y, glm.family = gaussian(),maxCol=32)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip)


obj=bic.glm(x[,17:32],y, glm.family = gaussian(),maxCol=32)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=res%>%
  rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))

knitr::kable(res)

var_2=res%>%
  filter(pip>10)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


x=train%>%
  select(var_2)%>%
  as.matrix()

final=bic.glm(x,y, glm.family = gaussian(),maxCol=32)


pip=final$probne0
vars=final$namesx


var_3=rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))%>%
  filter(pip>40)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


train_final=train%>%
  select(y,var_3)

final=bic.glm(y~., data=train_final,glm.family = gaussian(), strict = FALSE, OR = 20)


summary(final)


test=read.csv('../data/test/datacontinuousstudents_test.csv')

x_test=test%>%
  select(y,var_3)

y_hat=predict(final,x_test)

print('Test')
print(mean((x_test$y-y_hat)^2))


y_hat=predict(final,train_final)

print('Train')
print(mean((train_final$y-y_hat)^2))


```

## Binary case

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r bina}
train=read.csv('../data/train/databinarystudents_train.csv')%>%
  rename(y=yL)%>%
  filter(!is.na(id))
fam="binomial"


y=train%>%
  select(y)%>%
  as.matrix()
x=train%>%
  select(-y,-id)%>%
  as.matrix()


obj=bic.glm(x[,1:16],y, glm.family = fam)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip)


obj=bic.glm(x[,17:32],y, glm.family = fam,maxCol=32)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=res%>%
  rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))

knitr::kable(res)

var_2=res%>%
  filter(pip>10)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


x=train%>%
  select(var_2)%>%
  as.matrix()

final=bic.glm(x,y, glm.family = fam)


pip=final$probne0
vars=final$namesx


var_3=rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))%>%
  filter(pip>40)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


train_final=train%>%
  select(y,var_3)

final=bic.glm(y~., data=train_final,glm.family = fam, strict = FALSE, OR = 20)


summary(final)


test=read.csv('../data/test/databinarystudents_test.csv')%>%
  rename(y=yL)%>%
  filter(!is.na(id))

x_test=test%>%
  select(y,var_3)

y_hat=predict(final,x_test)

x_test%>%
  mutate(pred=ifelse(y_hat>0.5,1,0))%>%
  count(pred,y)%>%
  ggplot(aes(pred,y,fill=n,label=n))+geom_tile()+geom_text()

accuracy=function(pred,real){
  return(sum(pred==real)/length(pred))
}

y_hat=(predict(final,x_test)>0.5)*1

print('Test')
print(accuracy(x_test$y,y_hat))


y_hat=(predict(final,train_final)>0.5)*1

print('Train')
print(accuracy(train_final$y,y_hat))

```

## count case



```{r count}
train=read.csv('../data/train/datacountstudents_train.csv')%>%
  rename(y=yC)%>%
  filter(!is.na(id))

fam=poisson()


y=train%>%
  select(y)%>%
  as.matrix()
x=train%>%
  select(-y,-id)%>%
  as.matrix()


obj=bic.glm(x[,1:16],y, glm.family = fam)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip)


obj=bic.glm(x[,17:32],y, glm.family = fam,maxCol=32)

pip=obj$probne0
vars=obj$namesx

res=res%>%
  rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))

knitr::kable(res)

var_2=res%>%
  filter(pip>10)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


x=train%>%
  select(var_2)%>%
  as.matrix()

final=bic.glm(x,y, glm.family = fam)


pip=final$probne0
vars=final$namesx


var_3=rbind(data.frame(var=vars,pip=pip))%>%
  filter(pip>40)%>%
  select(var)%>%
  pull()%>%
  as.character()


train_final=train%>%
  select(y,var_3)

final=bic.glm(y~., data=train_final,glm.family = fam, strict = FALSE, OR = 20)

test=read.csv('../data/test/datacountstudents_test.csv')%>%

y_hat=predict(final,train_final)

print('Train')
print(mean((train_final$y-y_hat)^2))



```
